title: Fast Sync Falls Back to Full Sync on FastSyncException

labels.name: P4
labels.description: Low (ex: Node doesn't start up when the configuration file has unexpected "end-of-line" character)

body:
Currently, the only reason that can throw a FastSyncException is when we received conflicting pivot blocks. There is a maximum of 50 retries and during each retry we push back the pivot block.

* If after 50 retries the problem is still there we go to FullSync
* If we go back to the genesis block number we go to FullSync

Instead, in either of these cases, Besu should gracefully shut down with an error message prompting the user to re-try their fast sync. The rationale for this is that re-trying fast sync multiple times will still be quicker than full syncing. 

We should also consider increasing the number of retries, potentially up to 250. 

Logs with a FastSyncException :

The only reason that can throw a `FastSyncException` is when we received conflicting pivot blocks. There is a maximum of 50 retries and during each retry we push back the pivot block.
- If after 50 retries the problem is still there we go to FullSync
- If we go back to the genesis block number we go to FullSync

Logs with a `FastSyncException` : 
(https://app.zenhub.com/files/206414745/9183770c-13e4-4a52-b5ca-45cadfacf809/download)
